article.description: Marquise Pointer scored 19 points with four 3-pointers and six assists as College of Charleston knocked off Hofstra 72-61 on Thursday night.
article.headline: College of Charleston knocks of Hofstra 72-61
article.linkText: College of Charleston knocks of Hofstra 72-61
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Marquise Pointer scored 19 points with four 3-pointers and six assists as College of Charleston knocked off Hofstra 72-61 on Thursday night. Trailing 47-46 at the 13:13-mark, Pointer nailed a 3-point jumper to start a 12-4 run and give Charleston a 58-51 lead with 6:00 left. Pointer added a long trey to stretch the Cougars' lead to 58-51 lead with 5:11 remaining. The Cougar defense then stopped Hofstra on its next three trips down the floor. Cameron Johnson and Payton Hulsey had 12 points each for Charleston (10-4, 2-1 Colonial Athletic Association), which has won three of its last five games. Jarrell Brantley and Nick Harris chipped in 10 apiece. Hofstra (10-5, 2-1), picked to win the conference, had won two straight conference games before falling to the Cougars. Ameen Tanksley and Rokas Gustys had 16 each for Hofstra.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
